author: Debbie Fetterman
title: DRC offers discount to half marathoners registered for Saturday's cancelled Michelob Ultra 13.1 Dallas |
text:
The Dallas Running Club has offered 300 runners discounted spots into the Nov. 1 DRC Half Marathon in response to the cancellation of today's Michelob Ultra Dallas 13.1.
"When race directors make the decision to cancel a race, it's always difficult," said Steve Johnson, co-race director of the DRC Half. "But it's definitely always done with the safety of their runners in mind. We know it can be frustrating when you've trained so hard for a race that isn't going to happen."
The DRC has slashed the DRC Half Marathon registration fee to $50 for the 40 th DRC Half. It's a $35 discount from the current registration fee.
"This is a substantial discount over current registration costs and allows you the chance to put all those Saturday long runs and Tuesday tempo runs to the test on one of the best courses in Dallas," Johnson said.
Interested runners should send an e-mail with proof of their Dallas Michelob Ultra 13.1 registration (race confirmation or a race bib photo) to: DRCMU13.1@gmail.com . Upon receiving the e-mail, the DRC will send a discount code to use that will allow the discounted entry.
